recipes.name: Palak Gobi Sabzi
recipes.description: A simple and healthy dish of cauliflower and spinach cooked with tomatoes, ginger, and spices.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped ginger and green chillies. Saute for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add cauliflower florets and spinach leaves. Mix everything together.
Cover and cook until the cauliflower is tender and cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Aval Upma
recipes.description: A quick and easy breakfast or snack made with flattened rice, onions, green chillies, curry leaves, peanuts, and lemon juice.
instructions: Wash the flattened rice in water and drain well.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions, green chillies, and curry leaves. Saute until onions turn translucent.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the washed flattened rice and mix everything together.
Cook for a few minutes until the flattened rice is heated through.
Add roasted peanuts and lemon juice. Mix well.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chana Gassi
recipes.description: A Mangalorean style curry of chickpeas cooked in a coconut-based gravy with tamarind and spices.
instructions: Boil the soaked chickpeas until they are tender.
In a large pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and cook until they become golden brown.
Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and oil starts to separate.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander, and ground cumin. Mix well.
Add the boiled chickpeas and stir to coat them with the spices.
Add garam masala and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes until the flavors meld.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with bhature or rice.

recipes.name: Dali Thoy
recipes.description: A Karwar style dal curry made with toor dal, drumsticks, curry leaves, and mustard seeds.
instructions: Wash the toor dal and cook it with water in a pressure cooker until soft.
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add asafoetida, curry leaves, chopped onions, and green chillies. Saute until onions turn translucent.
Add drumstick pieces and cook for a few minutes.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the cooked toor dal and bring it to a boil.
Simmer for a few minutes until the flavors meld.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Kuska Biryani
recipes.description: A flavorful rice dish cooked with aromatic spices, ghee, and vegetable stock.
ingredients: A pinch of saffron strands (soaked in milk)
instructions: Wash and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat ghee and vegetable oil.
Add sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, biryani masala, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add yogurt, mint leaves, coriander leaves, fried onions, saffron milk, and salt. Mix everything together.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Mix gently.
Add vegetable stock (double the amount of rice) and bring it to a boil.
Cover the pot with a lid and simmer until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with cashews and raisins.
Serve the aromatic Kuska Biryani with raita or a side dish of your choice.

recipes.name: Paneer Bhatura
recipes.description: A soft and fluffy deep-fried bread served with a spicy paneer curry.
instructions: For Bhatura:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add yogurt and oil. Mix well and knead into a soft dough, adding water as needed.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 1-2 hours.
Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a circular shape.
Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.
Fry the rolled Bhatura in hot oil until they puff up and turn golden brown.
For Paneer Curry:
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and saute until they become translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies. Cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate.
Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add paneer cubes and stir gently to coat them with the spices.
Add fresh cream and simmer for a few minutes until the curry thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve the hot and delicious Paneer Bhatura with the spicy paneer curry.

recipes.name: Payyoli Chicken Fry
recipes.description: A Kerala style chicken fry marinated with ginger, garlic, turmeric, red chilli powder, and lemon juice and fried till crisp.
instructions: In a bowl, mix chicken pieces with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, black pepper powder, lemon juice, and salt.
Marinate the chicken for at least 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix rice flour and all-purpose flour.
Coat the marinated chicken pieces with the flour mixture.
Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.
Fry the coated chicken pieces until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Garnish with curry leaves.
Serve the flavorful Payyoli Chicken Fry as a delicious appetizer or side dish.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Dum Chai
recipes.description: A rich and creamy tea brewed with milk, water, tea leaves, cardamom, cloves, and saffron.
instructions: In a saucepan, add water, crushed cardamom pods, and cloves.
Bring the water to a boil and add tea leaves.
Simmer for a few minutes until the tea is brewed.
Add milk and saffron strands.
Let the tea simmer on low heat for a few more minutes.
Add sugar to taste and stir well.
Strain the chai into cups and serve hot with your favorite snacks or biscuits.

recipes.name: Aloo Kulcha
recipes.description: A stuffed flatbread filled with a spicy potato mixture and cooked on a tawa or griddle.
instructions: For the dough:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add yogurt and oil. Mix well and knead into a soft dough, adding water as needed.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 1-2 hours.
For the stuffing:
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds.
Add chopped onions and saute until they become translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chillies. Cook for a minute.
Add mashed potatoes, red chilli powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped coriander leaves and mix everything together.
Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle.
Place a spoonful of the potato stuffing in the center and seal the edges.
Flatten the stuffed ball and roll it into a kulcha.
Heat a tawa or griddle and cook the kulcha on both sides with ghee or butter until golden brown.
Serve the hot and delicious Aloo Kulcha with chole or your favorite curry.

recipes.name: Gulkand Ice Cream
recipes.description: A refreshing and fragrant ice cream made with rose petals, condensed milk, and cream.
ingredients: 1/4 cup rose syrup or gulkand (rose petal jam)
1/4 cup chopped rose petals (cleaned and pesticide-free)
A few drops of pink food coloring (optional)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Add condensed milk, rose syrup, rose essence, and pink food coloring (if using). Mix gently.
Fold in the chopped rose petals.
Transfer the mixture to a container and cover it with a lid.
Freeze the ice cream mixture for at least 6-8 hours or until set.
Serve the aromatic Gulkand Ice Cream in bowls or cones and enjoy!
